intro: Calyptropsidium friedrichsthalianum, commonly known as the Friedrichsthal's false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in a single head, resembling those of true dandelions. Its leaves are typically basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in open, sunny habitats and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
